headline: Greg Abel Era Begins As Berkshire Weighs Exit From Kraft Heinz
summary: Greg Abel has taken over as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A), succeeding Warren Buffett. The company is reported to be considering a full sale of its Kraft Heinz stake. This potential exit would mark a clear shift from Buffett’s long standing approach to large, enduring equity positions. Berkshire Hathaway is a diversified holding company with businesses spanning insurance, rail transport, energy, manufacturing, and consumer products, alongside a large portfolio of equity investments...
